text: Radiant tubing layout, spacing, loop lengths, and zone controls match approved drawings
Coordination confirmed with concrete team, slab contractor, and electrical/sprinkler trades
Tubing submittals reviewed for material, size, oxygen barrier rating, and bending radius
Slab insulation installed continuous under piping (rigid or reflective insulation per spec)
Tubing fastened securely with clips, mesh ties, or rail system – no uplift or float potential
Loop lengths verified per schedule; max circuit lengths not exceeded
Protective sleeves at expansion joints and penetrations
Manifolds mounted securely, with accessible headers and labeled loops
Tubing filled with water/glycol and pressure-tested (typically 100 psi for 2 hrs) before slab pour
Concrete poured while system under pressure and monitored throughout
No damage or kinks during pour; tubing locations marked on slab post-pour
Mixing valves, thermostatic heads, actuators, and control wiring installed as per zone map
Flow meters balanced at manifold; return temps verified for each loop
Controls tested for heating/cooling switching and temperature modulation
As-built drawings include tubing layout, manifold IDs, test results
O&M manual and balancing report submitted, startup complete

id: • Manufacturer Specs: Uponor, Viega, Rehau, Watts Radiant, Roth
